meanings.definition: A type of traditional Irish boat made of a wooden frame covered in animal hides or canvas.
meanings.sent1: The currachs were used by fishermen to navigate the rough waters.
meanings.sent2: We saw several currachs lined up along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The currachs decided to have a race to see who could reach the island first.
meanings.sent4: The currachs glided gracefully across the shimmering lake.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the currachs bobbing on the waves was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent6: After a long day of fishing, the currachs were safely docked in the harbor.
meanings.sent7: In the distance, the currachs appeared like tiny specks on the vast ocean.
meanings.sent8: The currachs were painted in bright colors, making them stand out against the gray sky.
meanings.sent9: As the storm approached, the currachs sought shelter in a secluded cove.
meanings.sent10: The currachs were a symbol of tradition and resilience in the coastal community.
